column4: Mounting /boot fails for me about 80% of the time, with the message "/dev/ide/host0/bus1/target0/lib0: p1".  I'm not finding anything useful on google.  Anyone have any ideas?
are U sure that's the complete error message'

That's the entry in dmesg and syslog.  Nothing prints to console.  In both cases, the time since boot preceeds the actual error.  Note that within a single boot cycle it may work, as long as I wait enough.
Add a file to /etc/init.d/ using start-stop-daemon.  Link this to /etc/rc?.d with a name like S99foo (for /etc/init.d/foo), and a sequence number indicating when you want it to start.
Well then, /boot doesn't mount without an error message.  Any ideas?
thanks... I was looking for a shortcut to that solution ;-)
... you said it hangs while trying to mount?
could you show me your fstab?
nothing hangs, just that message shows in dmesg, `ls /boot` returns nothing,  /proc/mounts fails to show an entry, and new files get stored on the / partition.
yes, it's repeated.  Some of that is me, and some the boot process.
when it does not mount try issueing mount -av
Alas, if it's hardware, I'll have to investigate otherwise.  Just for fun, I'm pasting a shortcut for /etc/init.d/foo to #flood.
does there exist the ugly, old rc.local :-(?
